docs.lead_paragraph: Texas is now in a highly prosperous condition. The Cotton crop of the State has been a full one,-especially have the cotton and sugar planters succeeded admirably. A much larger amount of sugar has been made, than over before--the quality of the article is good.

byline.original: Correspondence of the New York Daily Times:

headline.main: FROM ALBANY.; SPECIAL COMMITTEE ON THE MAINE LAW Notices of Bills to Equalize Way Fares on Railroads. INCREASE OF THE BANKING BASIS, The Report of the Superintendent of the Bank Department.

docs.lead_paragraph: In the Senate to day, Mr. MUNROE gave notice of a bill amending the act relative to officers of the Legislature. Mr. FIELD gave notice of a bill authorizing the Canal Commissioners to let by contract the work for keeping in repair the sections on the enlarged Erie, Canal.

byline.original: SPECIAL CORRESPONDENCE OF THE N. Y. DAILY TIMES

headline.main: BROOKLYN CITY.; Railroads in Brooklyn. The Manslaughter Case--The Defence. TEMPERANCE. BROOKLYN DISPENSARY. PLYMOUTH CHURCH. CITY MORTALITY.

docs.lead_paragraph: To The Editor of the New-York Daily Times: An areas appears in the editorial columns of the TIMES this morning, under the heading of "Railroads in Brooklyn," in which, among a great do?? that is probably just and proper, it strikes me that there is alitsle to Which those t??s cannot with property be applied.

headline.main: FROM THE PACIFIC COAST.; ARRIVAL OF THE ILLINOIS. ADDITIONAL FROM CALIFORNIA. Interesting from South America. Later from Oregon and Australia.

docs.lead_paragraph: The U. S. Mail steamship Illinois arrived at this port yesterday morning at 9 o'clock. She left Aspinwall with the passengers, mail and specie from the wrecked steamer Winfield Scott, brought from the wreck to Panama by steamer California, leaving San Francisco on the 7th of December, thus bringing seven days' later intelligence of a very interesting character.

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; COMMON COUNCIL PROCEEDINGS. Board of Councilmen. VETOES FROM THE MAYOR. FIRE DEPARTMENT. MESSAGES FROM THE MAYOR. GAS EXPLOSION- DEATH FROM RAILROAD INJURIES.-

docs.lead_paragraph: The Board was called to order by HORATIO N WILD, the temporary President. The roll was called by the Secretary, and fifty-one members answered to their names. Mr. CLIFTON moved that the reading of the minutes be dispensed with, which was carried. On motion, the Board then proceeded to ballot for President of the Board for the ensuing year.

docs.lead_paragraph: We have files and advices from Havana to Dec. 30, inclusive. The latest dates at that port were from New-Orleans Dec. 26; Valpariso, Sept. 16 ; Madrid, Nov. 25. There was not much change in the health of the Island, although the number of fatal cases of fever appeared to be diminishbing.

headline.main: FROM ST. THOMAS.; Outbreak of the Cholera--Small-Pox on an American Ship-of-War.

docs.lead_paragraph: While I write, our town is much excited under the fear that the cholera has broken out on the estate HULL, on the north side of the Island. On Friday last information was brought to the Police office, that five persons had died suddenly on that estate, and that others were sick. Steps were immediately taken by sending out three physicians to ascertain the nature of the disease. These

headline.main: FROM ALBANY.; CAUCUS OF THE MAINE LAW PARTY. Composition of Committees in the Senate, Fees of N. Y. Corporation Counsel. APPOINTMENT OF OFFICERS IN ASSEMBLY, Report of the Union College Committee. GENERAL PROCEEDINGS.

docs.lead_paragraph: The members of the Assembly in favor of the enactment of a law prohibiting the sale of intoxicating liquors, held a caucus in the Assembly Chamber this evening. There were about ninety members in attendance. Judge BURNET, of Essex, presided.
docs.snippet: The members of the Assembly in favor of the enactment of a law prohibiting the sale of intoxicating liquors, held a caucus in the Assembly Chamber this evening. There were about ninety members in attendance. Judge BURNET, of Essex, presided.

byline.original: SPECIAL DISPATCH TO NEW-YORK DAILY TIMES

headline.main: LATEST INTELLIGENCE; BY Telegraph to the New-York Daily Times. FROM THE CAPITAL. Cutting's Failure--Special Committee on the Pacific Railroad Bill--Trouble In the Treasury Department--The Nobraska Bill LATER FROM VALPARAISO. SECOND DISPATCH. Message of the Governor of Pennsylvania. Departure of the Steamship America--Marine Disasters and Loss of Life. Movements of Southern Steamships, Later from Texas. Dreadful Mortally at Sen. Destructive Fire at Albion, Mich. The Weather on the Lakes. Death of a Merchant.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. CUTTING'S move proves a decided failure. The Hards are discouraged if not discomfited. Only three Democrats front New-York stood up to CUTTING. A Special Committee of nine has been raised on the Pacific Railroad matter.
docs.snippet: Mr. CUTTING'S move proves a decided failure. The Hards are discouraged if not discomfited. Only three Democrats front New-York stood up to CUTTING. A Special Committee of nine has been raised on the Pacific Railroad matter.
